intro: Diaphananthe sanfordiana, commonly known as the Sanford's diaphananthe, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
